meta.title: From PAINT to BLACK
meta.author: Sandy Weisz and Mao Reynolds
meta.message: This week’s Raddles are inspired by songs by the Rolling Stones. Today’s is “Paint It Black” — sometimes stylized as “Paint It, Black” — which came out in 1966. Its use of sitar immediately sparked comparisons to the Beatles, who had also begun experimenting with elements of Indian music. Guitarist Brian Jones’ response to the comparison: “What utter rubbish.”
